intro: Urera repens, commonly known as creeping urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, with thin, hairy stems that root at the nodes. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a velvety texture and a distinct scent.
